entry.title: Breez Raises $4.5 Million In Fundraising Round
entry.summary: The funding will help accelerate Breezâ€™s mission of using Lightning to empower developers and users to realize new use cases for Bitcoin. Breez, a Lightning solution service provider, has raised $4.5 million in an oversubscribed funding round led by ego death capital and EntrÃ©e Capital. Other industry funds that participated include Hivemind Ventures, Fulgur Ventures, Hawk Digital Innovation and Bitcoiner Ventures. In a press release sent to Bitcoin Magazine, Breez CEO Roy Sheinfeld commented on the companyâ€™s Lightning as a Service (LaaS) approach, saying, â€œOur goal remains to bring Lightning to the masses, as it was on day one. LaaS is a natural evolution towards that goal. Conceptually, itâ€™s the best way to scale Lightning globally without sacrificing the values and attributes that makeâ€¦

entry.title: Is The Bitcoin Price Volatile? Itâ€™s All Relative
entry.summary:
The bitcoin price is often criticized as being too volatile, but as Einstein theorized, itâ€™s all in how you look at it. This is an opinion editorial by Tim Niemeyer, the co-host of the Lincolnland Bitcoin Meetup.
Source
Is bitcoin volatile? How does one determine volatility? How can those with diamond hands so decisively say â€œno,â€ while those stuck in the fiat mindset so emphatically say â€œyesâ€? Which one is correct? Is it just that both sides have to agree to disagree, or can both of these seeming contradictions simultaneously be true? To truly answer these questions, we should first analyze Albert Einsteinâ€™s special theory of relativityâ€¦ The Special Theory Of Relativity In Einsteinâ€™s attempt to better understand how the elapsed time of two câ€¦

entry.title: Scaling Bitcoin With Lightning As A Service Makes It Money That Really Matters
entry.summary: Developing Lighting as a Service (LaaS) removes friction from bitcoin and gives users the experiences they crave. This is an opinion editorial by Roy Sheinfeld, the cofounder and CEO of Breez, a Lightning Network mobile app. Ready for a hot take? Check this: Money has no inherent value. And, besides being a special kind of money that allows for disintermediated transfers, the same applies to bitcoin. As banal as it may sound, money is just a means to an end. As a matter of fact, itâ€™s a means to any number of ends. And those ends are what matter. Money â€” whether dollars, satoshis or the rai stones of Yap â€” is not valuable for what it is, but for what it lets us do. We transform money into experiences, and experiences are what make a life, not ledger entries. Everything else is bank propagaâ€¦

entry.title: How Bankman-Fried Wanted To Attack Binance And Others In Todayâ€™s Hearing
entry.summary:
Even though Sam Bankman-Fried has finally been arrested, the founder of FTX continues to make headlines.
Crypto Twitter is currently philosophizing that it is strange timing that SBF is arrested by Bahamian authorities the day before his hearing in front of the US Congress.
Bankman-Fried is reportedly in custody awaiting extradition to the United States. As a result, Bankman-Fried will not be able to give his testimony before the U.S. House of Representatives Financial Services Committee.
Instead, new FTX CEO John Ray will replace his predecessor. Remarkably, however, SBF already had a speech prepared to give today. Forbes managed to get a hold of that document.
Bankman-Fried Planned To Go Into Attack Mode
The document indicates that Bankman-Fried wanted to go into attack mode afâ€¦

entry.title: Report: Chinese Company Launches Digital Currency Insurance Product
entry.summary:
The Suzhou branch of the Chinese insurance company China Pacific Insurance, together with the Bank of Communications, recently announced the launch of a digital currency account insurance product. The launch comes at a time when the number of personal digital currency wallets created in the Chinese city of Suzhou alone now exceeds 30 million.
Insurance Product â€˜Guaranteesâ€™ Security of Digital Wallets
According to a report, the Suzhou branch of China Pacific Insurance along with the Bank of Communications branch in the same city, recently launched what has been described as the Asian countryâ€™s first central bank digital currency insurance product. It added that the launch â€œlays the foundation for the continuous and in-depth promotion of digital renminbi.â€

entry.title: Crypto Payment App MoonPay Receives Regulatory Approval From UK
entry.summary:
The cryptocurrency industry has gained more traction in recent years. More technological innovations and upgrades are also springing up in the space. Hence, many people have plunged into the crypto market as they intend to reap growing profits through a diversified investment approach.
But while the crypto space is advancing, criminal activities are also on the rise. So, some jurisdictions enacted regulatory rules to monitor the activities of digital asset-related firms. Also, they aim to protect users and participants in the digital asset space.
Cryptocurrency regulation in some countries is becoming increasingly stricter. For example, some regions will only allow the operation of crypto-related companies if they complete the regulatory registration. They could also sanction the firâ€¦

entry.title: Canada's CSA Labels Stablecoins as 'Securities and/or Derivatives'
entry.summary:
The Canadian Securities Administrators (CSA) is strengthening its oversight of the cryptocurrency industry following the collapse of FTX. It has expanded its requirements for crypto platforms operating in Canada.

The regulator will directly contact registered crypto platforms to discuss the new conditions while setting a deadline for registering unregistered platforms. Revamped conditions were justified, citing "recent events in the crypto market."

A previous regulatory notice issued last August already requires unregistered crypto platforms offering services in Canada to provide the regulators with

entry.title: Phantom Co-Founder Francesco Agosti at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: One of the minds behind the popular Solana dapp sits down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss the history of Phantom and what heâ€™s looking forward to in Web3.

entry.title: NFT Storytelling: Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry, Artemysia-X, Kas Vegas at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: "Lost Children of Andromeda" author Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry of Metagood and ACTAI Ventures, Artemysia-X of Rug Radio program LorePlay, and Kas Vegas of NFT INT, Huxley, and Feature.io all discussed how their work utilizes NFTs for storytelling, on a lively panel at Camp Decrypt moderated by What's Trending podcast host Shira Lazar.

entry.title: Edward Snowden Talks Tornado Cash Sanctions, Ethereum Merge, DAOs and NFTs at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: In an extensive talk with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Decrypt in Napa CA in October, Edward Snowden gave his candid views on the Ethereum merge, the sanctioning of Ethereum mixer Tornado Cash by the U.S. government, the privacy shortcomings of Bitcoin and Ethereum, and his view on using DAOs to source tips from whistleblowers.

entry.title: The New Landscape for NFT Drops: Bad Grrls Creative Club, BeetsDAO, and Cymbal at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: Amid a crypto bear market and recent declines in NFT sales volume, what's the new roadmap for new NFT collections? What's expected by community members and collectors? Toni Thai Sterrett of Bad Grrls Creative Club, Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO, and Eric Feng of NFT block explorer discussed with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at Camp Decrypt Napa.

entry.title: Musician 3LAU on His Music NFT Platform Royal: 'We Take Compliance Really Seriously'
entry.summary: Justin Blau aka 3LAU, CEO of Royal, talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin about building his company around compliance from the start. "We take compliance so seriously that it might make us move a little bit slower... but we think that's really how we have to build in the space." He also said he looks to Coinbase as a model.

entry.title: FTX Meltdown 101: What the Hell Happened and What Comes Next
entry.summary: In less than a week, one of the largest and most trusted crypto exchanges went up in flames, along with its crypto celebrity founder and CEO Sam Bankman-Fried. Dan Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Kate Irwin walk you through exactly how it happened, what it means for you, their own takes on the most interesting subplots, and what we can learn from it all. Plus: We review some comments SBF and CZ made on this podcast that look remarkable in hindsight. Watch Episode 23 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Justin Sun On the Future of Tron's USDD Stablecoin
entry.summary: The Tron founder tells Decrypt about the network's decentralized stablecoin USDD, and how Tron aims to "bridge the Web3 world with the real world.
